etymology.description: Depicts a flat-topped mountain or plateau -> conveys 'towering and bald'
etymology.interpretation: The character 兀(兀) (wù, 'towering and bald') pictures a flat-topped mountain or a plateau, illustrating something prominent yet bare, which aligns with the meaning of being 'towering and bald.' The depiction effectively conveys the sense of elevation without vegetation.

examples.chinese: 山巅上立着一座兀立的巨石(山巔上立著一座兀立的巨石)，显示出其独特风姿(顯示出其獨特風姿)。
examples.pinyin: Shān diān shàng lìzhe yī zuò wùlì de jùshí, xiǎnshì chū qí dútè fēngzī.
examples.english: At the mountain peak stands a towering, bald rock, showcasing its unique charm.

examples.chinese: 古城之巅耸立着一座兀然的楼阁(古城之巔聳立著一座兀然的樓閣)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ chéng zhī diān sǒnglì zhe yī zuò wùrán de lóuguè.
examples.english: On the top of the ancient city stands a towering and bald pavilion.
